description: Describes the lock status for a snapshot.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. lock-state - The state of the snapshot lock ( compliance-cooloff | governance | compliance | expired). (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: SnapshotIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the snapshots for which to view the lock status. (string) ---

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The account ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the snapshot.

nested_items.name: LockState
nested_items.description: The state of the snapshot lock. Valid states include:

compliance-cooloff - The snapshot has been locked in compliance mode but it is still within the cooling-off period. The snapshot can't be deleted, but it can be unlocked and the lock settings can be modified by users with appropriate permissions.
governance - The snapshot is locked in governance mode. The snapshot can't be deleted, but it can be unlocked and the lock settings can be modified by users with appropriate permissions.

compliance - The snapshot is locked in compliance mode and the cooling-off period has expired. The snapshot can't be unlocked or deleted. The lock duration can only be increased by users with appropriate permissions.
expired - The snapshot was locked in compliance or governance mode but the lock duration has expired. The snapshot is not locked and can be deleted.

nested_items.name: LockDuration
nested_items.description: The period of time for which the snapshot is locked, in days.

nested_items.name: CoolOffPeriod
nested_items.description: The compliance mode cooling-off period, in hours.

nested_items.name: CoolOffPeriodExpiresOn
nested_items.description: The date and time at which the compliance mode cooling-off period expires, in the UTC time zone ( YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

nested_items.name: LockCreatedOn
nested_items.description: The date and time at which the snapshot was locked, in the UTC time zone ( YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

nested_items.name: LockDurationStartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time at which the lock duration started, in the UTC time zone ( YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

nested_items.name: LockExpiresOn
nested_items.description: The date and time at which the lock will expire, in the UTC time zone ( YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ).

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.
